p: Similarly, Ungar (1998) identifies the use of words such as ‘assailant’ and ‘killer’ in newspaper articles describing Ebola, but within military discourse. The most widely used frame discovered in Vellek’s (2016) study even subsumes notions of a ‘killer’ alongside war and plague metaphors, rather than considering the killer from within a predatory model. The current study found greater reliance on the predatory model compared to militaristic images of the disease. This could be attributed to sampling because we selected news reports about the virus itself, rather than about how the disease is being managed.
